item.title: Chantelle add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "A person who has good thoughts cannot ever be ugly. You can have a wonky nose and a crooked mouth and a double chin and stick-out teeth, but if you have good thoughts they will shine out of your face like sunbeams and you will always look lovely." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Chantelle add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Unless someone like you cares a whole awful lot, Nothing is going to get better. It's not." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Chantelle add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "I like nonsense, it wakes up the brain cells. Fantasy is a necessary ingredient in living." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Chantelle add a quote by Dale Carnegie
item.description: "When dealing with people, let us remember we are not dealing with creatures of logic. We are dealing with creatures of emotion, creatures bristling with prejudices and motivated by pride and vanity." -- Dale Carnegie

item.title: Chantelle add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "I will speak ill of no man and speak all the good I know of everybody." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Chantelle add a quote by Herbert Spencer
item.description: "The great aim of education is not knowledge but action." -- Herbert Spencer

item.title: Chantelle add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "If everyone is thinking alike, then no one is thinking." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Chantelle add a quote by Dale Carnegie
item.description: "You can make more friends in two months by becoming interested in other people than you can in two years by trying to get other people interested in you." -- Dale Carnegie

item.title: Chantelle add a quote by Dale Carnegie
item.description: "The difference between appreciation and flattery? That is simple. One is sincere and the other insincere. One comes from the heart out; the other from the teeth out. One is unselfish; the other selfish. One is universally admired; the other universally condemned." -- Dale Carnegie

item.title: Chantelle add a quote by George Washington Carver
item.description: "When you do the common things in life in an uncommon way, you will command the attention of the world." -- George Washington Carver

item.title: Chantelle add a quote by Susanna Wesley
item.description: "Whatever weakens your reason, impairs the tenderness of your conscience, obscures your sense of God, takes off your relish for spiritual things, whatever increases the authority of the body over the mind, that thing is sin to you, however innocent it may seem in itself." -- Susanna Wesley

item.title: Chantelle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Never love anyone who treats you like you're ordinary." -- Oscar Wilde
